intro: Schizeilema ranunculus, commonly known as the water buttercup, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, bright yellow flowers with five petals and a hairy, lobed leaf structure. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments, thriving in moist soils near water bodies. Its leaves are often floating or submerged, adapted to aquatic conditions. Schizeilema ranunculus plays a role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
